questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization. You create a retention policy.
You need to ensure that all email older than one year is moved to an archive mailbox.
What should you use?

discussion.content: I would go with C. A. personal tag, needs to be manually assigned by the user to each folder. C. Default policy tag, will automatically do it for all folders.

Selected Answer: C
Answer C:
Only the Default Policy Tag or Personal tags have the option to move to Archive. 

As it is for ALL EMAILS you would set the Default Policy Tag as the Personal tags would be too manual setting for each user. 

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/security-and-compliance/messaging-records-management/retention-tags-and-policies

comments.content:
Personal policy tag will let user to decide should it be applied. The statement is "You need to ensure that all email older than one year is moved to an archive mailbox".

By default, each mailbox doesn't have retention policy assigned. If you assign 'Default MRM Policy' retention policy to a mailbox, only default retention tag ' Default 2 year move to archive' would be applied automatically, other retention tags are Personal...

I would say that this is correct answer, but little bit poorly presented.

the key word is retention policy not in place archiving tag . 
so i would go with c since we are dealing with tags in retention policy

discussion.content: C for sure. Compliance Management is also valid, but it is not the least privilege role. So the correct answer is "Records Management", option C.

The Records Management management role group is one of several built-in role groups that make up the Role Based Access Control (RBAC) permissions model in Microsoft Exchange Server 2013. Role groups are assigned one or more management roles that contain the permissions required to perform a given set of tasks. The members of a role group are granted access to the management roles assigned to the role group.

Users who are members of the Records Management role group can configure compliance features, such as retention policy tags, message classifications, and transport rules.
